How can I use the `getrawtransaction` method using the JSON-RPC interface?

You can use the `getrawtransaction` method using the JSON-RPC interface by sending a JSON payload to the Verus RPC server. The basic syntax is:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getrawtransaction", "params": ["mytxid", 1] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
This will send a JSON-RPC request to the Verus RPC server to retrieve the raw transaction data for the specified txid.

Examples:
> verus getrawtransaction "mytxid"
> verus getrawtransaction "mytxid" 1
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getrawtransaction", "params": ["mytxid", 1] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
